x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Pharmaceutical companies are required to collect, process, and report adverse drug reactions (ADRs) from patients and healthcare professionals to ensure patient safety. This is a regulatory requirement and a critical aspect of pharmacovigilance.
Currently, this process is highly manual, fragmented, and time-consuming: 1) Adverse events are often reported via email, phone calls, or paper forms. 2) Safety teams must manually collect data, validate reports, and enter them into safety systems.
Follow-up communication is not always timely or efficient. This creates delays in detecting safety issues and increases the risk of non-compliance with global regulatory bodies (e.g., FDA, EMA, WHO).

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • We propose an AI Agent built on ServiceNow that:
  • Conversational Interface (Virtual Agent + GenAI): Allows patients or healthcare providers to report adverse events via web, mobile, or chat.
  • Data Extraction: Uses AI/ML to extract structured data from unstructured inputs (emails, PDFs, forms).
  • Workflow Automation: Triggers pharmacovigilance workflows in ServiceNow for triage, validation, and escalation.
  • Regulatory Reporting: Integrates with regulatory systems to auto-generate and submit required forms (e.g., MedWatch, CIOMS).
  • Sentiment & Risk Scoring: AI Agent assigns urgency level based on language used and potential severity.

Case Management Dashboard: For pharmacovigilance teams to monitor, follow up, and ensure timely closure.

  • ServiceNow Virtual Agent + Generative AI
  • ServiceNow App Engine (for custom workflows)
  • Document Intelligence
  • IntegrationHub (for connecting to external safety systems)
  • Now Mobile (for patient self-reporting)
  • ServiceNow Case Management

 

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Access to NLP/ML models for extracting medical terms and drug information.
  • Integration with external pharmacovigilance systems (e.g., Argus Safety, Veeva Vault).
  • Support for multi-language input for global deployment.
  • Regulatory and data privacy compliance (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR).

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring high accuracy in AI interpretation of medical terms.
  • Maintaining data privacy and compliance across regions.
  • Gaining stakeholder buy-in from regulatory and IT departments.
  • Integration with legacy pharmacovigilance systems may require significant effort.
